Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Democratic Socialists of America Audiocassette Collection
Democratic Socialists of America
OH 058
1.5 Linear Feet 2 cassette boxes, and 1 folder
69 audiocassettes
1976-1996 The Democratic Socialists of America (DSA) was founded in 1982. DSA promotes a socialist conception of democracy, with a key objective being the coalition-building of progressive groups in the United States. Michael Harrington (1928-1989) was a founder and leader of DSA from 1982-1989, and the founder and head of its predecessor, the Democratic Socialist Organizing Committee (1972-1982). The collection consists of 69 tapes, spanning the years 1976 - 1996, with the bulk of the items falling between the years 1985-1995. The majority of the audiocassettes consist of conference, convention and meeting recordings of the DSA, interviews and speeches of Michael Harrington, and programs and lectures that were either sponsored by, or featured members of, DSA. Materials are in English.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restriction.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials in this collection were donated by the Democratic Socialists of America, date unknown; additional materials were donated by Eli Kaminsky in 2014. The accession numbers related to these gifts are 1980.017, 2006.066; and 2015.150.
Arrangement
Alphabetically by series topic and chronologically thereunder.
Organized into the following subgroups: I. Democratic Socialist Organizing Committee, series A as follows: A. Events; II. Democratic Socialists of America, 1982 - series A - C as follows: A. Meetings; B. Conferences; C. Programs; III. Harrington, Michael, - 1990, series A - D as follows: A. Debates; B. Interviews; C. Programs, D. Speeches and Lectures; IV. Miscellaneous, series A - C as follows: A. Interviews; B. Programs; C. Speeches and Lectures.

Historical/Biographical Note
The Democratic Socialists of America (DSA) was formed in 1982 after a merger of the Democratic Socialist Organizing Committee (DSOC) and the New American Movement (NAM). DSOC was formed in 1973 by a split in the Social Democrats USA; NAM was organized in 1971 by New Leftists. As a unified group, the DSA's ideology is based on a socialist conception of democracy. A key objective is to build a coalition of the major progressive forces in the United States, including trade unions, women's groups and minority organizations. Its tactics include grass-roots activity, working within existing mainstream institutions, and electoral politics within the left wing of the Democratic Party. The DSA is the U.S. affiliate to the Socialist International.
The structure of the DSA parallels that of the former DSOC. The decision-making bodies of the DSA consist of: the National Convention, which meets biennially; the National Board (NB), which meets between National Conventions and has the authority to charter local and regional organizations; the National Executive Committee (NEC), which meets between the National Boards and National conventions; and the National Interim Committee (NIC), a subcommittee of the NEC which meets between meetings of the NEC and is responsible for the supervision of all offices and staff of the organization. The National Board charters a Youth Section for full-time students age 30 and younger, which has its own locals and structured organization. The NB or the NEC can charter commissions. Members of the NEC serve as liaisons to the commissions and locals and can appoint committees (such as the NIC). Local and regional organizations, chartered by the NEC, carry out independent activities throughout the country.
Michael Harrington (1928-1989) was a U.S. socialist, editor, writer, founder and leader of DSA, and political leader best known for his book The Other America: Poverty in the United States 1962).
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Democratic Socialists of America Audiocassette Collection; OH 058; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
Processing decisions made prior to 2017 have not been recorded. In 2017, 19 audiocassettes containing recordings of a 1980 Institute for Democratic Socialism conference were added to Series I: Democratic Socialists Organizing Committee.
Related Material at the Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Michael Harrington Papers (TAM 209)
Michael Harrington - DSA Audiotapes (OH 048)
Democratic Socialists of America Records (TAM 105)
Scope and Content Note
The collection consists of 69 tapes, spanning the years 1976 - 1996, with the bulk of the items falling between 1985 - 1995. The majority of the audiocassettes consist of conference, convention and meeting recordings of the DSA, interviews and speeches of Michael Harrington, and programs and lectures that were either sponsored by, or featured members of, DSA. Many of the recordings feature or refer to DSA Co-Chairs Michael Harrington and Barbara Ehrenreich.
The collection has been divided into four subgroups: DSOC, DSA, Michael Harrington, and Miscellaneous. Subgroup One (DSOC) contains a recording of a rally sponsored by the Democratic Agenda Project, which was a joint venture between the DSOC and various progressive groups. Subgroup Two (DSA) contains organizational recordings of DSA, including conferences, meetings and sponsored programs. Subgroup Three (Michael Harrington) contains interviews, speeches and debates featuring Michael Harrington, some of which predate the founding of DSA (1982). Subgroup Four contains miscellaneous audiocassettes, some of which feature DSA members, but the majority whose contents or relationship to DSA are unidentified.
Conference recordings added to the collection in 2017 include 19 audiocassettes and a conference schedule from the the 1980 Institute for Democratic Socialism Conference "Eurosocialism and America: An International Exchange".
Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
Separated Material
A letter from the Political Science Department at Loyola University of Chicago to Michael Harrington regarding a lecture was removed from the collection.
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright to materials in this collection created by the Democratic Socialists of America was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder. Because of the assembled nature of this collection, copyright status varies across the collection. Copyright is assumed to be held by the original creator of individual items in the collection; these items are expected to pass into the public domain 120 years after their creation.

Series I: Democratic Socialist Organizing Committee1980
Scope and Contents
Materials in this series related to the "Eurosocialism and America" conference include a copy of the conference program and recordings of conference panels and plenary speeches. Not all panels from the conference were recorded. The printed conference schedule contains a full list of panels and speakers, with annotations indicating which sessions are included in the recordings. Notable individuals featured in the recordings include world leaders like Willy Brandt (Germany), Olof Palme (Sweden), Joop den Uyl (Netherlands), Francois Mitterand (France), as well as Michael Harrington, union leader William Winpisinger, Representative Ron Dellums, and Gloria Steinem.Sub-series A: Events.Democratic Agenda Rallycuid268August 15, 19801OH 58-1OH Shared Access Box 2OH 58-1Eurosocialism and America: An International Exchange Conference Recordings1980 December 5-72Eurosocialism and America: An International Exchange Conference Schedule1980 December 5-7MS0021Series II: Democratic Socialists of America1984-1992Sub-series A: Conferences.New Directions Conferencecuid26919861OH 58-2OH Shared Access Box 2OH 58-2
